An Acquired Taste.name: An Acquired Taste
An Acquired Taste.blurb: Tahm Kench puts the heft of his immense body behind his attacks and abilities, gaining extra damage based on his total health. Damaging enemy champions builds stacks of An Acquired Taste. At three stacks, he can use Devour on an enemy champion.
An Acquired Taste.description: Innate: Tahm Kench's basic attacks deal 4% of his maximum health  bonus magic damage. Against enemy champions they also apply An Acquired Taste stack for 5 seconds, stacking up to 3 times. The stacks decay once every 0.67 seconds after the stacks reach the full duration.
An Acquired Taste.description2: Tongue Lash and  Devour gain additional effects against enemies with three stacks.
An Acquired Taste.notes: * By calculating An Acquired Taste's base damage, using Tahm Kench's base health, we can define An Acquired Taste's damage in a different way: 24 − 92 (based on level) (+ 4% bonus health).

Tongue Lash.name: Tongue Lash
Tongue Lash.blurb: Tahm Kench lashes out with his tongue, damaging and slowing the first unit hit. This ability gains a stun after three stacks of An Acquired Taste.
Tongue Lash.description: Active: After a brief delay, Tahm Kench lashes his tongue in the target direction, dealing magic damage to the first enemy hit and  slowing them for 3 seconds.
Tongue Lash.description2: If an enemy champion is struck while at three  An Acquired Taste stacks, they're also  stunned for 2 seconds, consuming all stacks.
Tongue Lash.description3: During Tongue Lash,  Devour can be cast for no  mana to devour the  minion or non-epic  monster struck at the cost of no longer dealing Tongue Lash's damage. Devour's mana refund doesn't apply in this case.
Tongue Lash.notes: *  Devour can be 'queued' at any point during Tongue Lash (including the wind-up animation) and will not go on cooldown if Tahm Kench fails to hit a valid target with Tongue Lash.

Devour.name: Devour
Devour.blurb: Tahm Kench devours a target, dealing a percentage of their maximum health as magic damage. He can spit devoured minions and monsters out as a skillshot that deals magic damage in an area upon impact.
Devour.description: Active – Devour: Tahm Kench swallows an enemy minion, non-epic monster or allied champion, making them  untargetable and unable to take any actions for 4 seconds.
Devour.description2: Tahm Kench can swallow an enemy champion if they have three  An Acquired Taste stacks. If Tahm Kench swallows an allied or enemy champion, he is  grounded and  slowed by 95% for the duration. Swallowing a targeted enemy champion only lasts for half the duration, down to 2 seconds, consumes all their An Acquired Taste stacks,  suppresses and makes them  untargetable.
Devour.description3: Swallowing an enemy refunds  50% of the cooldown and  50% of the mana cost.
Devour.description4: After 1 second, Devour can be recast into  Regurgitate while Tahm Kench's belly is full. Allied champions can exit at will after the same delay, unless they're  immobilized.
Devour.notes:
* The  self-slow is affected by slow resist.
 Devour will prioritize champions (cannot be used on those who are channeling an ability) over minions.
 If champions stay on top of each other it will prioritize those who stay beneath.

 Tahm Kench cannot use  Teleport,  Flash, or  Dark Passage while holding an enemy champion in his belly (he can when holding an allied champion or minion).
 Devour cannot be used on epic monsters ( Vilemaw,  Rift Herald,  Dragon,  Baron Nashor) and on  Sion during his  Glory in Death.
 Devour will not interrupt persistent area-of-effect abilities ( Glacial Storm, Slicing Maelstrom,  Burnout) non-channeled ones ( The Culling,  Center of the Universe,  Celestial Expansion) damage over time ( Ignite) or delayed single-target damage ( Death Mark) but will interrupt the delayed area-of-effect kind ( Explosive Charge).
  Quicksilver Sash will cleanse Devour's  suppression but the damage will still be dealt.

Regurgitate.name: Regurgitate
Regurgitate.blurb: Tahm Kench devours a target, dealing a percentage of their maximum health as magic damage. He can spit devoured minions and monsters out as a skillshot that deals magic damage in an area upon impact.
Regurgitate.description: Active – Regurgitate: Tahm Kench regurgitates the swallowed target. If they are an enemy they also take magic damage, capped at 500 against monsters.
Regurgitate.leveling:
Magic Damage:
60 / 105 / 150 / 195 / 240 (+ 11% (+ 2% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health)
Regurgitate.description2: Minions and non-epic monsters that are spat forth can collide with an enemy or terrain to deal magic damage to all enemies around them and themselves before taking Regurgitate's stun damage.
Regurgitate.notes:
*  Quicksilver Sash will cleanse Devour's  suppression but the damage will still be dealt.
 Regurgitate can send allies to the other side of small walls.

Thick Skin.name: Thick Skin
Thick Skin.blurb: Tahm Kench turns incoming damage into gray health. As gray health decays, Tahm Kench is healed for a percentage of the gray health amount. When activated, this ability turns all gray health into a shield.
Thick Skin.description: Passive: Tahm Kench stores a percentage of the damage he takes as Grey Health on his health bar, up to a maximum of 100% of his missing health.
Thick Skin.description2: While Thick Skin is available, and after taking no damage for 2.5 seconds, Tahm Kench rapidly  heals for 30% − 100% (based on level) of his Grey Health over time.
Thick Skin.description3: Active: Tahm Kench converts his current Grey Health into a  shield that lasts for 2 seconds.
Thick Skin.notes:
* Thick Skin shield value and Grey Health percentage heal are both boosted by effects that increase heal and shield power. This means you can technically heal more than the normal amount of Grey Health and get a shield bigger than your maximum health.
 At level 18 Tahm Kench would need 53.8%  heal power to heal for 100% of the damage he takes, reduced to 39.9% with  Revitalize, 18.3% with  Spirit Visage, and 7.6% with both.

 Grey Health converts all post-mitigation damage, Thick Skin effectively grants Tahm Kench a form of true damage mitigation.
 Grey Health can temporarily exceed 100% of his missing health when Tahm Kench heals through other means with a Grey Health bar at 100%. In that case he will keep the higher Grey Health value for a few moments until it updates and removes the amount that he healed.

Abyssal Voyage.name: Abyssal Voyage
Abyssal Voyage.blurb: Tahm Kench teleports across the map, and he may bring one ally champion with him.
Abyssal Voyage.description: Active: Tahm Kench  channels for up to 6 seconds, highlighting the path to his intended destination to allied champions while opening his maw to offer up to one of them the chance to come with him. If an ally has climbed in, Tahm Kench automatically begins a 1 second channel.
Abyssal Voyage.description2: After a 0.25-second delay, Tahm Kench can reactivate  Abyssal Voyage to begin the channel without an ally. Once the channel is completed, Tahm Kench and the ally that has climbed in will  blink to the target location, arriving after a 0.5-second delay.
Abyssal Voyage.description3: Taking damage or cancelling the channel interrupts Abyssal Voyage, putting it on a  10 second cooldown. Abyssal Voyage cannot be activated while Tahm Kench has a  full belly.
Abyssal Voyage.notes:
* Allies may still join Tahm Kench by clicking him while he performs Abyssal Voyage's second cast's animation.
 Allies in combat with enemy champions cannot jump into Abyssal Voyage.
 Abyssal Voyage, upon recast, will alert Tahm Kench's arrival to nearby enemies and allies with a ping.
